risks.divergence_summary: The internal policy excerpt is silent on all mandatory requirements of the new regulation, including workplace safety protocols, health insurance, and employee data protection, indicating a significant policy gap.
risks.conflicting_policy_excerpt: - Employees must comply with their assigned working schedules, record their working time honestly and report any situation likely to exceed legal limits.
risks.new_rule_excerpt: All companies must implement workplace safety protocols. Employers must provide health insurance to all employees. Employers must protect employee personal data.
risks.recommendation: Develop comprehensive internal policies addressing all mandatory requirements of the new regulation, including workplace safety, health insurance, data protection, emergency procedures, and audit requirements, to ensure full compliance by December 31, 2025.

risks.divergence_summary: The internal policy excerpt is critically deficient, failing to address numerous mandatory requirements of the new regulation, including workplace safety protocols, health insurance provision, encryption of all employee records, and audit requirements.
risks.conflicting_policy_excerpt: - **Managers** ensure that the policy is applied within their teams and that staff are aware of their obligations. - **All employees and users** who have access to personal data must comply with this policy and the related procedures.
risks.new_rule_excerpt: All companies must implement workplace safety protocols. Employers must provide health insurance to all employees. Companies shall encrypt all employee records. Annual audits are mandatory for all companies.
risks.recommendation: Conduct a comprehensive gap analysis of all relevant internal policies against the new regulation and develop new or updated policies to explicitly address all mandatory requirements, especially workplace safety, health insurance, data encryption, and audit procedures.
